name: sensor
description: The sensor tag describes the type and properties of a sensor.

children.name: name
children.description: A unique name for the sensor. This name must not match another model in the model.

children.name: type
children.description: The type name of the sensor. By default, SDFormat supports types air_pressure, air_speed, altimeter, camera, contact, boundingbox_camera, boundingbox, custom, depth_camera, depth, force_torque, gps, gpu_lidar, gpu_ray, imu, lidar, logical_camera, magnetometer, multicamera, navsat, ray, rfid, rfidtag, rgbd_camera, rgbd, segmentation_camera, segmentation, sonar, thermal_camera, thermal, wireless_receiver, and wireless_transmitter. The "ray", "gpu_ray", and "gps" types are equivalent to "lidar", "gpu_lidar", and "navsat", respectively. It is preferred to use "lidar", "gpu_lidar", and "navsat" since "ray", "gpu_ray", and "gps" will be deprecated. The "ray", "gpu_ray", and "gps" types are maintained for legacy support.

children.name: always_on
children.description: If true the sensor will always be updated according to the update rate.

children.name: update_rate
children.description: The frequency at which the sensor data is generated. If left unspecified, the sensor will generate data every cycle.

children.name: visualize
children.description: If true, the sensor is visualized in the GUI

children.name: topic
children.description: Name of the topic on which data is published. This is necessary for visualization

children.name: enable_metrics
children.description: If true, the sensor will publish performance metrics

children.name: frame_id
children.description: An optional frame id which indicates the sensor's frame of reference.

children.name: pose
children.description: A pose (translation, rotation) expressed in the frame named by @relative_to. The first three components (x, y, z) represent the position of the element's origin (in the @relative_to frame). The rotation component represents the orientation of the element as either a sequence of Euler rotations (r, p, y), see http://sdformat.org/tutorials?tut=specify_pose, or as a quaternion (x, y, z, w), where w is the real component.

children.name: relative_to
children.description: If specified, this pose is expressed in the named frame. The named frame must be declared within the same scope (world/model) as the element that has its pose specified by this tag. If missing, the pose is expressed in the frame of the parent XML element of the element that contains the pose. For exceptions to this rule and more details on the default behavior, see http://sdformat.org/tutorials?tut=pose_frame_semantics. Note that @relative_to merely affects an element's initial pose and does not affect the element's dynamic movement thereafter. New in v1.8: @relative_to may use frames of nested scopes. In this case, the frame is specified using `::` as delimiter to define the scope of the frame, e.g. `nested_model_A::nested_model_B::awesome_frame`.

children.name: rotation_format
children.description: 'euler_rpy' by default. Supported rotation formats are 'euler_rpy', Euler angles representation in roll, pitch, yaw. The pose is expected to have 6 values. 'quat_xyzw', Quaternion representation in x, y, z, w. The pose is expected to have 7 values.

children.name: degrees
children.description: Whether or not the euler angles are in degrees, otherwise they will be interpreted as radians by default.

children.name: plugin
children.description: A plugin is a dynamically loaded chunk of code. It can exist as a child of world, model, and sensor.

children.name: name
children.description: A name for the plugin.

children.name: filename
children.description: Name of the shared library to load. If the filename is not a full path name, the file will be searched for in the configuration paths.

children.name: Elements
children.description: Arbitrary elements and attributes that can be used to configure the plugin

children.name: air_pressure
children.description: These elements are specific to an air pressure sensor.

children.name: reference_altitude
children.description: The initial altitude in meters. This value can be used by a sensor implementation to augment the altitude of the sensor. For example, if you are using simulation instead of creating a 1000 m mountain model on which to place your sensor, you could instead set this value to 1000 and place your model on a ground plane with a Z height of zero.

children.name: pressure
children.description: Noise parameters for the pressure data.

children.name: noise
children.description: The properties of a sensor noise model.

children.name: type
children.description: The type of noise. Currently supported types are: "none" (no noise). "gaussian" (draw noise values independently for each measurement from a Gaussian distribution). "gaussian_quantized" ("gaussian" plus quantization of outputs (ie. rounding))

children.name: mean
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the mean of the Gaussian distribution from which noise values are drawn.

children.name: stddev
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the standard deviation of the Gaussian distribution from which noise values are drawn.

children.name: bias_mean
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the mean of the Gaussian distribution from which bias values are drawn.

children.name: bias_stddev
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the standard deviation of the Gaussian distribution from which bias values are drawn.

children.name: dynamic_bias_stddev
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the standard deviation of the noise used to drive a process to model slow variations in a sensor bias.

children.name: dynamic_bias_correlation_time
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the correlation time in seconds of the noise used to drive a process to model slow variations in a sensor bias. A typical value, when used, would be on the order of 3600 seconds (1 hour).

children.name: precision
children.description: For type "gaussian_quantized", the precision of output signals. A value of zero implies infinite precision / no quantization.

children.name: air_speed
children.description: These elements are specific to an air speed sensor. This sensor determines speed based on the differential between static and dynamic pressure.

children.name: pressure
children.description: Noise parameters for the pressure data.

children.name: noise
children.description: The properties of a sensor noise model.

children.name: type
children.description: The type of noise. Currently supported types are: "none" (no noise). "gaussian" (draw noise values independently for each measurement from a Gaussian distribution). "gaussian_quantized" ("gaussian" plus quantization of outputs (ie. rounding))

children.name: mean
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the mean of the Gaussian distribution from which noise values are drawn.

children.name: stddev
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the standard deviation of the Gaussian distribution from which noise values are drawn.

children.name: bias_mean
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the mean of the Gaussian distribution from which bias values are drawn.

children.name: bias_stddev
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the standard deviation of the Gaussian distribution from which bias values are drawn.

children.name: dynamic_bias_stddev
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the standard deviation of the noise used to drive a process to model slow variations in a sensor bias.

children.name: dynamic_bias_correlation_time
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the correlation time in seconds of the noise used to drive a process to model slow variations in a sensor bias. A typical value, when used, would be on the order of 3600 seconds (1 hour).

children.name: precision
children.description: For type "gaussian_quantized", the precision of output signals. A value of zero implies infinite precision / no quantization.

children.name: altimeter
children.description: These elements are specific to an altimeter sensor.

children.name: vertical_position
children.description: Noise parameters for vertical position

children.name: noise
children.description: The properties of a sensor noise model.

children.name: type
children.description: The type of noise. Currently supported types are: "none" (no noise). "gaussian" (draw noise values independently for each measurement from a Gaussian distribution). "gaussian_quantized" ("gaussian" plus quantization of outputs (ie. rounding))

children.name: mean
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the mean of the Gaussian distribution from which noise values are drawn.

children.name: stddev

children.name: bias_mean

children.name: dynamic_bias_correlation_time
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the correlation time in seconds of the noise used to drive a process to model slow variations in a sensor bias. A typical value, when used, would be on the order of 3600 seconds (1 hour).

children.name: precision
children.description: For type "gaussian_quantized", the precision of output signals. A value of zero implies infinite precision / no quantization.

children.name: vertical_velocity
children.description: Noise parameters for vertical velocity

children.name: noise
children.description: The properties of a sensor noise model.

children.name: type
children.description: The type of noise. Currently supported types are: "none" (no noise). "gaussian" (draw noise values independently for each measurement from a Gaussian distribution). "gaussian_quantized" ("gaussian" plus quantization of outputs (ie. rounding))

children.name: mean
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the mean of the Gaussian distribution from which noise values are drawn.

children.name: stddev
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the standard deviation of the Gaussian distribution from which noise values are drawn.

children.name: bias_mean
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the mean of the Gaussian distribution from which bias values are drawn.

children.name: bias_stddev
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the standard deviation of the Gaussian distribution from which bias values are drawn.

children.name: dynamic_bias_stddev
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the standard deviation of the noise used to drive a process to model slow variations in a sensor bias.

children.name: dynamic_bias_correlation_time
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the correlation time in seconds of the noise used to drive a process to model slow variations in a sensor bias. A typical value, when used, would be on the order of 3600 seconds (1 hour).

children.name: precision
children.description: For type "gaussian_quantized", the precision of output signals. A value of zero implies infinite precision / no quantization.

children.name: camera
children.description: These elements are specific to camera sensors.

children.name: name
children.description: An optional name for the camera.

children.name: triggered
children.description: If the camera will be triggered by a topic

children.name: camera_info_topic
children.description: Name of the camera info

children.name: trigger_topic
children.description: Name of the topic that will trigger the camera if enabled

children.name: horizontal_fov
children.description: Horizontal field of view

children.name: image
children.description: The image size in pixels and format.

children.name: width
children.description: Width in pixels

children.name: height
children.description: Height in pixels

children.name: format
children.description: (L8|L16|R_FLOAT16|R_FLOAT32|R8G8B8|B8G8R8|BAYER_RGGB8|BAYER_BGGR8|BAYER_GBRG8|BAYER_GRBG8)

children.name: anti_aliasing
children.description: Value used for anti-aliasing

children.name: clip
children.description: The near and far clip planes. Objects closer or farther than these planes are not rendered.

children.name: near
children.description: Near clipping plane

children.name: far
children.description: Far clipping plane

children.name: save
children.description: Enable or disable saving of camera frames.

children.name: enabled
children.description: True = saving enabled

children.name: path
children.description: The path name which will hold the frame data. If path name is relative, then directory is relative to current working directory.

children.name: depth_camera
children.description: Depth camera parameters

children.name: output
children.description: Type of output

children.name: clip
children.description: The near and far clip planes. Objects closer or farther than these planes are not detected by the depth camera.

children.name: near
children.description: Near clipping plane for depth camera

children.name: far
children.description: Far clipping plane for depth camera

children.name: segmentation_type
children.description: The segmentation type of the segmentation camera. Valid options are: - semantic: Semantic segmentation, which provides 2 images: 1. A grayscale image, with the pixel values representing the label of an object 2. A colored image, with the pixel values being a unique color for each label - panoptic | instance: Panoptic segmentation, which provides an image where each pixel has 1 channel for label value of the object and 2 channels for the number of the instances of that label, and a colored image which its pixels have a unique color for each instance.

children.name: box_type
children.description: The boundingbox type of the boundingbox camera. Valid options are: - 2d | visible_2d | visible_box_2d: a visible 2d box mode which provides axis aligned 2d boxes on the visible parts of the objects - full_2d | full_box_2d: a full 2d box mode which provides axis aligned 2d boxes that fills the object dimensions, even if it has an occluded part - 3d: a 3d mode which provides oriented 3d boxes

children.name: noise
children.description: The properties of the noise model that should be applied to generated images

children.name: type
children.description: The type of noise. Currently supported types are: "gaussian" (draw additive noise values independently for each pixel from a Gaussian distribution).

children.name: mean
children.description: For type "gaussian," the mean of the Gaussian distribution from which noise values are drawn.

children.name: stddev
children.description: For type "gaussian," the standard deviation of the Gaussian distribution from which noise values are drawn.

children.name: distortion
children.description: Lens distortion to be applied to camera images. See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Distortion_(optics)#Software_correction

children.name: k1
children.description: The radial distortion coefficient k1

children.name: k2
children.description: The radial distortion coefficient k2

children.name: k3
children.description: The radial distortion coefficient k3

children.name: p1
children.description: The tangential distortion coefficient p1

children.name: p2
children.description: The tangential distortion coefficient p2

children.name: center
children.description: The distortion center or principal point

children.name: lens
children.description: Lens projection description

children.name: type
children.description: Type of the lens mapping. Supported values are gnomonical, stereographic, equidistant, equisolid_angle, orthographic, custom. For gnomonical (perspective) projection, it is recommended to specify a horizontal_fov of less than or equal to 90°

children.name: scale_to_hfov
children.description: If true the image will be scaled to fit horizontal FOV, otherwise it will be shown according to projection type parameters

children.name: custom_function
children.description: Definition of custom mapping function in a form of r=c1*f*fun(theta/c2 + c3). See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fisheye_lens#Mapping_function

children.name: c1
children.description: Linear scaling constant

children.name: c2
children.description: Angle scaling constant

children.name: c3
children.description: Angle offset constant

children.name: f
children.description: Focal length of the optical system. Note: It's not a focal length of the lens in a common sense! This value is ignored if 'scale_to_fov' is set to true

children.name: fun
children.description: Possible values are 'sin', 'tan' and 'id'

children.name: cutoff_angle
children.description: Everything outside of the specified angle will be hidden, 90° by default

children.name: env_texture_size
children.description: Resolution of the environment cube map used to draw the world

children.name: intrinsics
children.description: Camera intrinsic parameters for setting a custom perspective projection matrix (cannot be used with WideAngleCamera since this class uses image stitching from 6 different cameras for achieving a wide field of view). The focal lengths can be computed using focal_length_in_pixels = (image_width_in_pixels * 0.5) / tan(field_of_view_in_degrees * 0.5 * PI/180)

children.name: fx
children.description: X focal length (in pixels, overrides horizontal_fov)

children.name: fy
children.description: Y focal length (in pixels, overrides horizontal_fov)

children.name: cx
children.description: X principal point (in pixels)

children.name: cy
children.description: Y principal point (in pixels)

children.name: s
children.description: XY axis skew

children.name: projection
children.description: Camera projection matrix P for overriding camera intrinsic matrix K values so that users can configure P independently of K. This is useful when working with stereo cameras where P may be different from K due to the transform between the two cameras.

children.name: p_fx
children.description: X focal length for projection matrix(in pixels, overrides fx)

children.name: p_fy
children.description: Y focal length for projection matrix(in pixels, overrides fy)

children.name: p_cx
children.description: X principal point for projection matrix(in pixels, overrides cx)

children.name: p_cy
children.description: Y principal point for projection matrix(in pixels, overrides cy)

children.name: tx
children.description: X translation for projection matrix (in pixels)

children.name: ty
children.description: Y translation for projection matrix (in pixels)

children.name: visibility_mask
children.description: Visibility mask of a camera. When (camera's visibility_mask & visual's visibility_flags) evaluates to non-zero, the visual will be visible to the camera.

children.name: optical_frame_id
children.description: An optional frame id name to be used in the camera_info message header.

children.name: pose
children.description: A pose (translation, rotation) expressed in the frame named by @relative_to. The first three components (x, y, z) represent the position of the element's origin (in the @relative_to frame). The rotation component represents the orientation of the element as either a sequence of Euler rotations (r, p, y), see http://sdformat.org/tutorials?tut=specify_pose, or as a quaternion (x, y, z, w), where w is the real component.

children.name: relative_to
children.description: If specified, this pose is expressed in the named frame. The named frame must be declared within the same scope (world/model) as the element that has its pose specified by this tag. If missing, the pose is expressed in the frame of the parent XML element of the element that contains the pose. For exceptions to this rule and more details on the default behavior, see http://sdformat.org/tutorials?tut=pose_frame_semantics. Note that @relative_to merely affects an element's initial pose and does not affect the element's dynamic movement thereafter. New in v1.8: @relative_to may use frames of nested scopes. In this case, the frame is specified using `::` as delimiter to define the scope of the frame, e.g. `nested_model_A::nested_model_B::awesome_frame`.

children.name: rotation_format
children.description: 'euler_rpy' by default. Supported rotation formats are 'euler_rpy', Euler angles representation in roll, pitch, yaw. The pose is expected to have 6 values. 'quat_xyzw', Quaternion representation in x, y, z, w. The pose is expected to have 7 values.

children.name: degrees
children.description: Whether or not the euler angles are in degrees, otherwise they will be interpreted as radians by default.

children.name: contact
children.description: These elements are specific to the contact sensor.

children.name: collision
children.description: name of the collision element within a link that acts as the contact sensor.

children.name: topic
children.description: Topic on which contact data is published.

children.name: force_torque
children.description: These elements are specific to the force torque sensor.

children.name: frame
children.description: Frame in which to report the wrench values. Currently supported frames are: "parent" report the wrench expressed in the orientation of the parent link frame, "child" report the wrench expressed in the orientation of the child link frame, "sensor" report the wrench expressed in the orientation of the joint sensor frame. Note that for each option the point with respect to which the torque component of the wrench is expressed is the joint origin.

children.name: measure_direction
children.description: Direction of the wrench measured by the sensor. The supported options are: "parent_to_child" if the measured wrench is the one applied by the parent link on the child link, "child_to_parent" if the measured wrench is the one applied by the child link on the parent link.

children.name: force
children.description: These elements are specific to measurement-frame force, which is expressed in Newtons

children.name: x
children.description: Force along the X axis

children.name: noise
children.description: The properties of a sensor noise model.

children.name: type
children.description: The type of noise. Currently supported types are: "none" (no noise). "gaussian" (draw noise values independently for each measurement from a Gaussian distribution). "gaussian_quantized" ("gaussian" plus quantization of outputs (ie. rounding))

children.name: mean
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the mean of the Gaussian distribution from which noise values are drawn.

children.name: stddev
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the standard deviation of the Gaussian distribution from which noise values are drawn.

children.name: bias_mean
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the mean of the Gaussian distribution from which bias values are drawn.

children.name: bias_stddev
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the standard deviation of the Gaussian distribution from which bias values are drawn.

children.name: dynamic_bias_stddev
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the standard deviation of the noise used to drive a process to model slow variations in a sensor bias.

children.name: dynamic_bias_correlation_time
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the correlation time in seconds of the noise used to drive a process to model slow variations in a sensor bias. A typical value, when used, would be on the order of 3600 seconds (1 hour).

children.name: precision
children.description: For type "gaussian_quantized", the precision of output signals. A value of zero implies infinite precision / no quantization.

children.name: y
children.description: Force along the Y axis

children.name: noise
children.description: The properties of a sensor noise model.

children.name: precision
children.description: For type "gaussian_quantized", the precision of output signals. A value of zero implies infinite precision / no quantization.

children.name: torque

children.name: gps
children.description: These elements are specific to the GPS sensor.

children.name: position_sensing
children.description: Parameters related to GPS position measurement.

children.name: horizontal
children.description: Noise parameters for horizontal position measurement, in units of meters.

children.name: noise
children.description: The properties of a sensor noise model.

children.name: type
children.description: The type of noise. Currently supported types are: "none" (no noise). "gaussian" (draw noise values independently for each measurement from a Gaussian distribution). "gaussian_quantized" ("gaussian" plus quantization of outputs (ie. rounding))

children.name: mean
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the mean of the Gaussian distribution from which noise values are drawn.

children.name: stddev
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the standard deviation of the Gaussian distribution from which noise values are drawn.

children.name: bias_mean
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the mean of the Gaussian distribution from which bias values are drawn.

children.name: bias_stddev
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the standard deviation of the Gaussian distribution from which bias values are drawn.

children.name: dynamic_bias_stddev
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the standard deviation of the noise used to drive a process to model slow variations in a sensor bias.

children.name: dynamic_bias_correlation_time
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the correlation time in seconds of the noise used to drive a process to model slow variations in a sensor bias. A typical value, when used, would be on the order of 3600 seconds (1 hour).

children.name: precision
children.description: For type "gaussian_quantized", the precision of output signals. A value of zero implies infinite precision / no quantization.

children.name: imu
children.description: These elements are specific to the IMU sensor.

children.name: localization
children.description: This string represents special hardcoded use cases that are commonly seen with typical robot IMU's: - CUSTOM: use Euler angle custom_rpy orientation specification. The orientation of the IMU's reference frame is defined by adding the custom_rpy rotation to the parent_frame. - NED: The IMU XYZ aligns with NED, where NED orientation relative to Gazebo world is defined by the SphericalCoordinates class. - ENU: The IMU XYZ aligns with ENU, where ENU orientation relative to Gazebo world is defined by the SphericalCoordinates class. - NWU: The IMU XYZ aligns with NWU, where NWU orientation relative to Gazebo world is defined by the SphericalCoordinates class. - GRAV_UP: where direction of gravity maps to IMU reference frame Z-axis with Z-axis pointing in the opposite direction of gravity. IMU reference frame X-axis direction is defined by grav_dir_x. Note if grav_dir_x is parallel to gravity direction, this configuration fails. Otherwise, IMU reference frame X-axis is defined by projection of grav_dir_x onto a plane normal to the gravity vector. IMU reference frame Y-axis is a vector orthogonal to both X and Z axis following the right hand rule. - GRAV_DOWN: where direction of gravity maps to IMU reference frame Z-axis with Z-axis pointing in the direction of gravity. IMU reference frame X-axis direction is defined by grav_dir_x. Note if grav_dir_x is parallel to gravity direction, this configuration fails. Otherwise, IMU reference frame X-axis is defined by projection of grav_dir_x onto a plane normal to the gravity vector. IMU reference frame Y-axis is a vector orthogonal to both X and Z axis following the right hand rule.

children.name: custom_rpy
children.description: This field and parent_frame are used when localization is set to CUSTOM. Orientation (fixed axis roll, pitch yaw) transform from parent_frame to this IMU's reference frame. Some common examples are: - IMU reports in its local frame on boot. IMU sensor frame is the reference frame. Example: parent_frame="", custom_rpy="0 0 0" - IMU reports in Gazebo world frame. Example sdf: parent_frame="world", custom_rpy="0 0 0" - IMU reports in NWU frame. Uses SphericalCoordinates class to determine world frame in relation to magnetic north and gravity; i.e. rotation between North-West-Up and world (+X,+Y,+Z) frame is defined by SphericalCoordinates class. Example sdf given world is NWU: parent_frame="world", custom_rpy="0 0 0" - IMU reports in NED frame. Uses SphericalCoordinates class to determine world frame in relation to magnetic north and gravity; i.e. rotation between North-East-Down and world (+X,+Y,+Z) frame is defined by SphericalCoordinates class. Example sdf given world is NWU: parent_frame="world", custom_rpy="M_PI 0 0" - IMU reports in ENU frame. Uses SphericalCoordinates class to determine world frame in relation to magnetic north and gravity; i.e. rotation between East-North-Up and world (+X,+Y,+Z) frame is defined by SphericalCoordinates class. Example sdf given world is NWU: parent_frame="world", custom_rpy="0 0 -0.5*M_PI" - IMU reports in ROS optical frame as described in http://www.ros.org/reps/rep-0103.html#suffix-frames, which is (z-forward, x-left to right when facing +z, y-top to bottom when facing +z). (default gazebo camera is +x:view direction, +y:left, +z:up). Example sdf: parent_frame="local", custom_rpy="-0.5*M_PI 0 -0.5*M_PI"

children.name: parent_frame
children.description: Name of parent frame which the custom_rpy transform is defined relative to. It can be any valid fully scoped Gazebo Link name or the special reserved "world" frame. If left empty, use the sensor's own local frame.

children.name: grav_dir_x
children.description: Used when localization is set to GRAV_UP or GRAV_DOWN, a projection of this vector into a plane that is orthogonal to the gravity vector defines the direction of the IMU reference frame's X-axis. grav_dir_x is defined in the coordinate frame as defined by the parent_frame element.

children.name: parent_frame
children.description: Name of parent frame in which the grav_dir_x vector is defined. It can be any valid fully scoped Gazebo Link name or the special reserved "world" frame. If left empty, use the sensor's own local frame.

children.name: angular_velocity
children.description: These elements are specific to body-frame angular velocity, which is expressed in radians per second

children.name: x
children.description: Angular velocity about the X axis

children.name: bias_mean

children.description: For type "gaussian*", the standard deviation of the noise used to drive a process to model slow variations in a sensor bias.

children.description: For type "gaussian*", the correlation time in seconds of the noise used to drive a process to model slow variations in a sensor bias. A typical value, when used, would be on the order of 3600 seconds (1 hour).

children.description: For type "gaussian_quantized", the precision of output signals. A value of zero implies infinite precision / no quantization.

children.name: enable_orientation
children.description: Some IMU sensors rely on external filters to produce orientation estimates. True to generate and output orientation data, false to disable orientation data generation.

children.name: lidar
children.description: These elements are specific to the lidar sensor.

children.name: samples
children.description: The number of simulated lidar rays to generate per complete laser sweep cycle.

children.name: resolution
children.description: This number is multiplied by samples to determine the number of range data points returned. If resolution is not equal to one, range data is interpolated.

children.name: max_angle
children.description: Must be greater or equal to min_angle

children.name: samples
children.description: The number of simulated lidar rays to generate per complete laser sweep cycle.

children.name: resolution
children.description: This number is multiplied by samples to determine the number of range data points returned. If resolution is not equal to one, range data is interpolated.

children.name: max_angle
children.description: Must be greater or equal to min_angle

children.name: range
children.description: specifies range properties of each simulated lidar

children.name: min
children.description: The minimum distance for each lidar ray.

children.name: max
children.description: The maximum distance for each lidar ray.

children.name: resolution
children.description: Linear resolution of each lidar ray.

children.name: noise
children.description: The properties of the noise model that should be applied to generated scans

children.name: type
children.description: The type of noise. Currently supported types are: "gaussian" (draw noise values independently for each beam from a Gaussian distribution).

children.name: mean
children.description: For type "gaussian," the mean of the Gaussian distribution from which noise values are drawn.

children.name: stddev
children.description: For type "gaussian," the standard deviation of the Gaussian distribution from which noise values are drawn.

children.name: visibility_mask
children.description: Visibility mask of a lidar. When (lidar's visibility_mask & object's visibility_flags) evaluates to non-zero, the object will be visible to the lidar.

children.name: logical_camera
children.description: These elements are specific to logical camera sensors. A logical camera reports objects that fall within a frustum. Computation should be performed on the CPU.

children.name: near
children.description: Near clipping distance of the view frustum

children.name: far
children.description: Far clipping distance of the view frustum

children.name: aspect_ratio
children.description: Aspect ratio of the near and far planes. This is the width divided by the height of the near or far planes.

children.name: horizontal_fov
children.description: Horizontal field of view of the frustum, in radians. This is the angle between the frustum's vertex and the edges of the near or far plane.

children.description: The properties of a sensor noise model.

children.name: type
children.description: The type of noise. Currently supported types are: "none" (no noise). "gaussian" (draw noise values independently for each measurement from a Gaussian distribution). "gaussian_quantized" ("gaussian" plus quantization of outputs (ie. rounding))

children.name: mean
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the mean of the Gaussian distribution from which noise values are drawn.

children.name: stddev
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the standard deviation of the Gaussian distribution from which noise values are drawn.

children.name: bias_mean
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the mean of the Gaussian distribution from which bias values are drawn.

children.name: bias_stddev
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the standard deviation of the Gaussian distribution from which bias values are drawn.

children.name: dynamic_bias_stddev
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the standard deviation of the noise used to drive a process to model slow variations in a sensor bias.

children.name: dynamic_bias_correlation_time
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the correlation time in seconds of the noise used to drive a process to model slow variations in a sensor bias. A typical value, when used, would be on the order of 3600 seconds (1 hour).

children.name: precision
children.description: For type "gaussian_quantized", the precision of output signals. A value of zero implies infinite precision / no quantization.

children.name: vertical
children.description: Noise parameters for vertical velocity measurement, in units of meters/second.

children.name: noise
children.description: The properties of a sensor noise model.

children.name: type
children.description: The type of noise. Currently supported types are: "none" (no noise). "gaussian" (draw noise values independently for each measurement from a Gaussian distribution). "gaussian_quantized" ("gaussian" plus quantization of outputs (ie. rounding))

children.name: mean
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the mean of the Gaussian distribution from which noise values are drawn.

children.name: stddev
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the standard deviation of the Gaussian distribution from which noise values are drawn.

children.name: bias_mean
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the mean of the Gaussian distribution from which bias values are drawn.

children.name: bias_stddev
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the standard deviation of the Gaussian distribution from which bias values are drawn.

children.name: dynamic_bias_stddev
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the standard deviation of the noise used to drive a process to model slow variations in a sensor bias.

children.name: dynamic_bias_correlation_time
children.description: For type "gaussian*", the correlation time in seconds of the noise used to drive a process to model slow variations in a sensor bias. A typical value, when used, would be on the order of 3600 seconds (1 hour).

children.name: precision
children.description: For type "gaussian_quantized", the precision of output signals. A value of zero implies infinite precision / no quantization.

children.name: ray
children.description: These elements are specific to the ray (laser) sensor.

children.name: samples
children.description: The number of simulated rays to generate per complete laser sweep cycle.

children.name: resolution
children.description: This number is multiplied by samples to determine the number of range data points returned. If resolution is less than one, range data is interpolated. If resolution is greater than one, range data is averaged.

children.name: max_angle
children.description: Must be greater or equal to min_angle

children.name: samples
children.description: The number of simulated rays to generate per complete laser sweep cycle.

children.name: resolution
children.description: This number is multiplied by samples to determine the number of range data points returned. If resolution is less than one, range data is interpolated. If resolution is greater than one, range data is averaged.

children.name: max_angle
children.description: Must be greater or equal to min_angle

children.name: range
children.description: specifies range properties of each simulated ray

children.name: min
children.description: The minimum distance for each ray.

children.name: max
children.description: The maximum distance for each ray.

children.name: resolution
children.description: Linear resolution of each ray.

children.name: noise
children.description: The properties of the noise model that should be applied to generated scans

children.name: type
children.description: The type of noise. Currently supported types are: "gaussian" (draw noise values independently for each beam from a Gaussian distribution).

children.name: mean
children.description: For type "gaussian," the mean of the Gaussian distribution from which noise values are drawn.

children.name: stddev
children.description: For type "gaussian," the standard deviation of the Gaussian distribution from which noise values are drawn.

children.name: visibility_mask
children.description: Visibility mask of a ray sensor. When (rays' visibility_mask & object's visibility_flags) evaluates to non-zero, the object will be visible to the ray sensor.

children.name: sonar
children.description: These elements are specific to the sonar sensor.

children.name: geometry
children.description: The sonar collision shape. Currently supported geometries are: "cone" and "sphere".

children.name: min
children.description: Minimum range

children.name: max
children.description: Max range

children.name: radius
children.description: Radius of the sonar cone at max range. This parameter is only used if geometry is "cone".

children.name: transceiver
children.description: These elements are specific to a wireless transceiver.

children.name: essid
children.description: Service set identifier (network name)

children.name: frequency
children.description: Specifies the frequency of transmission in MHz

children.name: min_frequency
children.description: Only a frequency range is filtered. Here we set the lower bound (MHz).

children.name: max_frequency
children.description: Only a frequency range is filtered. Here we set the upper bound (MHz).

children.name: gain
children.description: Specifies the antenna gain in dBi

children.name: power
children.description: Specifies the transmission power in dBm

children.name: sensitivity
children.description: Minimum received signal power in dBm
